metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: XQuery is to XML what SQL is to databases.
content.html: XQuery is to XML what SQL is to databases.

content.text: XQuery is designed to query XML data.
content.html: XQuery is designed to query XML data.

content.code:
for $x in doc("books.xml")/bookstore/book

where $x/price>30

order by $x/title

return $x/title
content.code_html:
for $x in doc("books.xml")/bookstore/book
where $x/price>30
order by $x/title
return $x/title

content.text: XQuery is a language for finding and extracting elements and attributes from XML documents.
content.html: XQuery is a language for finding and extracting elements and attributes from XML documents.

content.text: Here is an example of what XQuery could solve:
content.html: Here is an example of what XQuery could solve:

content.text: "Select all CD records with a price less than $10 from the CD collection stored in cd_catalog.xml"
content.html: "Select all CD records with a price less than $10 from the CD collection stored in cd_catalog.xml"

content.text: XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 share the same data model and support the same functions and operators. If you have already studied XPath you will have no problems with understanding XQuery.
content.html: XQuery 1.0 and XPath 2.0 share the same data model and support the same functions and operators. If you have already studied XPath you will have no problems with understanding XQuery.

content.text: XQuery is compatible with several W3C standards, such as XML, Namespaces, XSLT, XPath, and XML Schema.
content.html: XQuery is compatible with several W3C standards, such as XML, Namespaces, XSLT, XPath, and XML Schema.

content.text: XQuery 1.0 became a W3C Recommendation in 2007.
